ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Intensive knowledge of the Balkans region, and more importantly key insights into the world of diplomacy from one of the classiest and most knowledgeable professors I have ever had.
Learned so much about BiH history and culture. Also the consultancy style project and group work.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: While the course could have been more structured, ultimately the freer form allowed for more initiative and simulated a real-world situation far better.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Rob was an incredible instructor! I was so grateful to have a knowledgeable and hands-on professor at the helm of this project.
Frankly, every Global Affairs major should hope they get David Robinson as their advisor.
Yes, a great choice for Capstone project
